3: The pure white world is stable and sweet.
The world is no longer pale as Wanshi regains consciousness. He realizes he is inside a building.
The surrounding walls are covered with neat and orderly knife scratches as if someone was counting something. However, there are far too many scratches to count now.
Wanshi tries to send activation signals to his limbs, but his attempts are futile.
Hmph... Guess I can't move.
Right as he tries to assess the damage to his body, his vision is filled with the black hole of a muzzle.
I wouldn't move if I were you.
(Seeing as he didn't kill me while I was out, I'd wager he isn't a part of the same organization as that 'Gear' thing. Maybe I...)
While Wanshi is thinking about what to say, the old man takes the initiative.
Hey, what the hell are you?
Huh?
You look like a human, but there ain't a single human thing aboutcha.
You're obviously a machine, but you ain't acting like those crazy ****ers wanderin' around outside. Who are you and whatcha doin' here?
Choose your words carefully. Dependin' on your answer, you'll either be greeted with a bullet from my gun or a good mornin' kiss.
I'm just a Construct that came here by mistake...
Huh? What the hell is a Construct?
And with that, the old man aims his rifle at Wanshi's forehead.
Don't you know...? It's a bit of hassle to explain. In short, it is a humanoid robot made of tantalum copolymer with the help of a human consciousness module...
Alright, alright, alright! Enough!
...So, they put a human brain in this tin can?
Uh... I guess you could put it like that.
****, ain't that some blasphemy. Do humans really wanna run around on Earth like that?
The old man spits to the side and lowers his rifle from Wanshi's forehead.
I ain't ever seen any fella like you before.
...Construct, eh? That's a mouthful. I'll just call you by your name. Name's Arnold. What's your name?
Uh... Wanshi.
Wanshi? ****, that ain't much better.
Anyways, looks like you've seen better days.
This place has been abandoned for quite some time. I ain't seen anyone alive here in ages. How'd you end up here?
...I don't remember. I don't even know where this place is.
All I know is that the mission I was carrying out failed, so I was en route to the evac point.
And then... I, uh... just fell asleep.
More like knocked the **** out. Fell asleep my ***.
You were on a mission, eh...? Lookin' at your gear and nameplate, guessin' you're a soldier?
Don't wanna tell me who ya are? Not like it matters.
I wouldn't be goin' 'round runnin' my mouth tellin' my life story to folks I just met neither.
Sorry.
Don't mention it. Soldiers are all the same. I get it.
Oh... You were a soldier?
I just know a dumb*** war vet is all.
Sounds like you two were close...
Live long enough, and you'll find yourself a few buddies. Same goes for you, right?
Uh... You could say so.
With wounds as bad as these, I can hear them yelling at me whenever I close my eyes...
I ain't no grease monkey, but I can sure as hell say it's a miracle you made it this far.
If me and my buddy hadn't kept workin' on you while you were knocked out, who knows when you'da woken up.
Just like that, a small round robot appears at Wanshi's bedside. Arnold waves to the robot, and it jumps on his shoulder. It seems that this is what Arnold calls his 'buddy.'
We could only patch you up a bit. After all, I ain't ever seen this kinda tech before.
Thanks... But why did you help me?
Tch... Because of a promise I made with that dumb***.
Of course, I got my own reasons. But that's in the past.
Anyways, you're safe for now.
Arnold gestures with his hand and walks over to a corner.
You hungry, Wanshi? I still got some canned herrin'.
Constructs can eat. But in theory, we don't have to.
(Whistles) Ain't that convenient.

Arnold takes out a knife from his waistband and skillfully opens some bulging cans. Suddenly, a strange pungent smell fills the confined space and somehow manages to reactivate Wanshi's damaged smell module.
Phew... What's that? I think I'd have nightmares if I ate that.
Kids these days. It tastes healthy and keeps you on your toes. And to think I wanted to share it with you. Guests ain't easy to come by, ya know?
Now ain't like it was in the past. When I'd eat, I'd set up a table outside and ask my buddy to play my favorite bass tunes.
I'd eat herrin' with crispbread, potato and butter, listen to tunes, and kick up my feet in the evenin' breeze. No people makin' a ruckus and none of these buildings blockin' my view of the sky.
Moonlight and stars shinin' all over me—ain't nothin' like that now.
After opening the can with his knife, Arnold begins munching on the fish as he reflects on scenes of his past.
But thanks to those monsters, it ain't easy findin' supplies and I can't stay out too long.
Oh... Wow. I can't even imagine.
Bahahaha! That's normal. A lotta stuff ya gotta see for yourself.
Arnold smiles and puts the last piece of fish from the can in his mouth with his knife.
Just then, Wanshi notices the sphere bot on Arnold's shoulder shutter slightly.
Why's there always gotta be problems when I'm eatin'?
What is it?
Ain't nothin'. I gotta go out for a sec.
Really? At a time like this?
You betcha. How else would an ol' man like me still be around?
Arnold grabs his rifle, climbs up the ladder on the wall, opens the closed hatch above his head, and leaves the room.
Well, I guess I'll take this time to...
Right as Arnold leaves, Wanshi closes his eyes and begins to run diagnostics on the extent of internal damage.
Has the damage from the battle and the side effects from the temporary blockage now completely blocked my internal connection circuits? What a drag...
Looking around, a cloud of gray and yellow dust fills the underground space. The only light within the room comes from the beta lamp overhead.
On one side of the room, parts are stacked on what appears to be a mechanical workbench. However, the layer of dust indicates that these items have not been used in quite some time.
I wonder if Troy has reached the evac point safely.
After thinking for a while, Wanshi shakes his head and closes his eyes.
Well, looks like there's nothing I can do right now. I guess I'll just kick up my feet for a while...
I'm back! Miss me, kiddo?
Yawn... Oh, you're back...
Arnold's loud voice wakes up Wanshi. Half-awake, Wanshi barely manages to open his eyes and look in Arnold's direction.
Oof, today took a little longer than usual.
After climbing down the ladder, Arnold throws his rifle to the side and collapses on the shabby sofa in the corner.
I dunno why, but there are more of those damn monsters wanderin' 'round outside than ever before.
They're wanderin' 'round like a herd of sheep.
Could it be...
Don't worry 'bout it. I took care of them already.
Arnold reaches for his windbreaker, then quickly points his finger out in front of him like shooting a gun.
All the top actors used to do this.
Oh... You don't say...
Tsk, you kiddos don't understand why women used to fall head over heels for this kinda thing.
Arnold's mouth curls into a half-hearted smile. He crosses his legs and reclines on the sofa.
I wonder if these monsters are actin' so strange has got somethin' to do with labelin' you as some sorta fugitive...
Yeah... I think this place is going to be crawling with danger here soon.
You leave while you still can, Arnold.
Who the hell do you think I am?
Think I can just leave you here in your condition and save my own hide?
But you don't have to do it for a stranger...
I don't care even if we just met. I ain't gonna do it.
Do you know what it's like livin' in a prosperous and bleak metropolis?
City-folk turn a blind eye to those around 'em. That's how awful society was like during the Golden Age.
Hmph. People used to care about each other.
You won't read about that in those data files of yours.
Changes like that in society can't be recorded in those files with just a few words or statistics.
I've seen the kindness of humanity and experienced the indifference of society.
Human society flourished for a time, but then they became indifferent to each other.
I can't watch people survive in such indifference and selfishness. I ain't gonna join them, and I sure as hell ain't gonna be like them.
But that don't mean I hate humanity. Quite the opposite actually. We can't just give up on others, no matter who it is.
Callin' it 'escaping' sounds nice, but it's really just weakness.
I don't wanna see this kinda weakness in humanity, so that's why I live here alone with my buddy.
But I still can't sit by and ignore the lives of others.
So ya see, it's the two of us who are gonna get outta here alive.
But...
But I know you can't move in your condition.
So, how 'bout this. I fix ya up, and we get the hell outta Dodge?
Huh?
Don't underestimate this ol' timer. I used to be a doctor. That's how I've managed to modify this ol' body of mine and keep it up and running for so long.
Arnold walks up to Wanshi and lifts up his coat, revealing numerous surgical scars covering his body.
...I see.
But it ain't easy operatin' alone. That's why I built my partner here to lend a hand.
Arnold straightens out his clothes with one hand and pats the sphere bot on his shoulder with the other.
Well then, tell me what I need to know to get up in there and fix those nuts and bolts of yours. I can't just go in blind. I wanna show you my handiwork.
Arnold dusts off the workstation and wheels it over to Wanshi's bedside.
Like you said, time is of the essence. Let's get this over and done with.
